note.div: A comma seperated list of folders. These folders will be ignored by this job. If the folder name ends with * than the folder and all subfolders will be ignored.
A comma seperated list of job chains. Then name can contain wildcards % which will cover all signs The name is used as a regular expression These job chains will be ignored by this job.
A comma seperated list of jobs. Then name can contain wildcards % which will cover all signs The name is used as a regular expression These jobs will be ignored by this job.
A comma seperated list of jobs. If this parameter is set, only those jobs will be started. Then names can contain wildcards % which will cover all signs The names are used as a regular expression

A comma seperated list of orders. If this parameter is set, only those orders will be started. Then names can contain wildcards % which will cover all signs The names are used as a regular expression. The orders are specified as job_chain(orderId) where (orderId) is optional. If no orderId is set then all orders of the job chain are handled by the job.
Specify the number of days to look in the past. Example: 10d looks ten days into the past.
If true no job (orders) will be startet but just listed in the log.

documentation.div:
The job checks for late orders and late jobs that are in the "Waiting state". If a job or an order has been found, the job starts the job and the orders depending on the given parameters.
The job looks into the actual days daily plan for latecomers.
